thread.title: Boyfriend 'cheating' at Burger King gets caught out after making basic mistake on social media
thread.title_full: Boyfriend 'cheating' at Burger King gets caught out after making basic mistake on social media

author: Nicola Oakley
title: Boyfriend 'cheating' at Burger King gets caught out after making basic mistake on social media
text:
Boyfriend 'cheating' at Burger King gets caught out after making basic mistake on social media His girlfriend was not at all happy about it Share The man made a comment on Instagram - but his girlfriend happened to see it (Photo: jordan_vonsmith86/Instagram) Share   
A woman wasn't too happy with her boyfriend after spotting a throwaway comment he made on a public Instagram page. 
The man commented on a photograph posted by Burger King and accidentally gave away that he had been with another woman the previous night, the Daily Mail reports . 
Posting a comment on a photo published by Burger King, Instagram user @jordan_vonsmith86 complained about the fast food giant's service, saying: "My girl legit took 20 minutes ordering in the drive thru last night, those whoppers were worth it tho lol" 
A seemingly innocent comment. But then came another comment... apparently from his girlfriend. 
"Umm excuse me @jordan_vonsmith86??? I don't recall going last night or ever liking Burger King who are you talking about?" she wrote. 
She quickly followed up her question with "answer your f***ing phone". 
Uh oh. 
Jordan quickly told her she needed to "chill out", claiming "I was with @kitcass01 and we were just catching up." 
But this made @kitcass01 unhappy with him, too. "please don't bring me into this", she commented. 
If she thought that would excuse her from the whole messy situation, it didn't, as Jordan's girlfriend took it upon herself to reply: "F*** you, you brought yourself into this you fat b****." 
Shanlee then tagged some friends in the comments, who jumped in and backed her up, saying they had seen him with girls in the past. (Photo: https://www.instagram.com/shanlee_rose//Instagram) 
Instagram users are now flocking to Burger King's Instagram account to see how the argument turned out, but they appear to have been deleted - much to their disappointment. 
aminebattas wrote: "Where are the comments of the couple fighting lol i wanna know what happened later" 
vicarondo was totally honest, commenting: "Whose (sic) only here because they've read about the couple breaking up on here somewhere." 
Of course, some people are cynical and think the two accounts have been created by Burger King to generate publicity. 
ggomez_89 commented: "Burger king making up bullshit stories for publicity. The couples accounts are faker than the meat in your burgers." 
If that's the case, then it certainly worked. Like us on Facebook
